overview:
Matt Hulett is both a serial entrepreneur and seasoned public company executive who has successfully built profitable (and re-built) companies from scratch.

Hulett currently runs the games division (GameHouse) at RealNetworks. He was also most recently the Executive Chairman and CEO of AdXpose Corporation. AdXpose is now a leader in online advertising optimization recently purchased by comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) in Q3 2011. Before AdXpose, Hulett was President of the corporate travel division of Expedia, Inc., the world’s largest online travel company, where he launched the corporate travel business from an idea to a billion dollar worldwide leader in just a couple of years. Prior to Expedia, Matt was a founding partner of the next generation entertainment company, AtomFilms. He served as President of Atom Entertainment, a firm backed by both Sequoia Capital and Macromedia and was purchased by Viacom (NYSE: VIA). Early in his career Hulett was the founding consumer products leader at RealNetworks launching many of the companies most successful products including the RealPlayer and its premium subscription software businesses. He started out his career learning to love UNIX running the market-leading Reflection X product line at AttachmateWRQ, a privately held provider of enterprise software. A Seattle native, Matt is a Puget Sound Business Journal 40-under-40 recipient.
